description: The Gaza war has worsened the human rights situation in Israel, a new State Department report says, citing claims of crimes by Hamas and the Israeli government.
title: U.S. cites a litany of rights violations in Israel, Gaza and West Bank

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is expected to cut military aid to Israel’s ‘Netzah Yehuda’ battalion, over human rights allegations. Here’s what to know.
title: What is Israel’s Netzah Yehuda battalion, and why could it face U.S. aid cuts?

description: Russian authorities appear to be intensifying their crackdown on critics of the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine by prosecuting individuals quoted by international media.
title: Russian man sentenced to 5 years of labor for criticizing war in Ukraine

description: The independent report said the U.N. Relief and Works Agency was in need of critical reforms to ensure it remains neutral, but that Israel had not shown evidence to support its claims that large numbers of staffers were tied to militant groups.
title: Report says Israel has not provided evidence of widespread militancy among UNRWA staff

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi warned of “infiltrators” who could steal the country’s wealth.
title: Modi accused of ‘hate speech’ toward India’s Muslims in election rally

description: With elections looming and his party plummeting in the polls, British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has made “stopping the boats” one of his top campaign promises.
title: Britain’s Sunak vows to deport asylum seekers to Rwanda in 10-12 weeks

description: Heavy rains continued to batter southern China on Monday, forcing tens of thousands of people from their homes as rescuers raced to evacuate those trapped by flooding and locate at least 11 missing residents.
title: In photos: Heavy rains batter Chinese province of Guangdong causing massive floods

description: Maj. Gen. Aharon Haliva is the first general to leave his position in Israel’s military over the failures leading up to the Oct. 7 Hamas attack.
title: Israeli military intelligence head resigns over Oct. 7 Hamas attack

description: Chinese censors are cracking down on ultra-short dramas — the latest entertainment craze — that do not adhere to Communist Party ideals about family values.
title: Mama’s boys and marital strife are no joke in today’s China

description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he spoke to senior U.S. officials about the possibility of sanctions and promised to fight any such measures.
title: Middle East conflict live updates: Israeli leaders criticize potential U.S. sanctions on IDF unit

description: Once-in-a-century rains are wreaking havoc in the manufacturing powerhouse of Guangdong. Floods and landslides are expected, and schools have been closed.
title: Chinese province of Guangdong braces for historic floods

description: By the weekend, the immediate threat of escalation seems to have been lifted between Iran and Israel. But there’s less reason for optimism when it comes to Gaza.
title: As Israel-Iran clash cools, Gaza’s crisis remains
